column1:
## History of presenting illness
79 years old man who came in on the 2024-01-29 with a suspected influenza. Found on the floor where patient lives.

## Past medical history
Advanced COPD, smoker, benign prostate hyperplasia.

## Treatment course
Patient complains of headache and pain in left hip. No findings in physical examination. Temp 38,7. Sat 85%. PCR positive for Influenza A. CT brain, cervical spine and pelvis without remarks. CT thorax: patchy bilateral pulmonary infiltrates and 9 mm large nodular change in the left upper lobe. Received Oseltamivir and Cefotaxime intravenously for Influenza infection. Received Oxygen with saturation limit 90%. Dyspnea only when mobilizing. Shown growth of Moraxella in the nasopharyngeal culture. No findings in other cultures. LPK normal. Temp 38,8. Liver enzymes a bit elevated, assessed to be due to influenza. No fever. Saturation 95% with 1 l oxygen but declined to 88% without Oxygen. Receives a urinary catheter because of residual urine 533 ml. Recieves Movicol for contstipation. After five days of Cefotaxim switch to per oral doxycycline until 2024-02-04 after contact with infectious disease consultant. Transported to the geriatric care department according to recommendationts of physiotherapist and occupational therapist .

## Medications
Anoro Ellipta (Umeclidinium, Vilanterol)	55/22 Î¼g/Î¼g 1+0+0
Finasterid (Finasteride) 5 Mg	1+0+0
Tamiflu (Oseltamivir) 75 Mg 1+0+1
Alvedon (Paracetamol) 500 Mg 2+2+2
Doxycyklin (Doxycycline)100 Mg 1+0+0 until 2024-02-04

## Plan after discharge
Referral to primary care for radiological control of nodular change in left upper lobe in 8-12 weeks.

## Procedures
  None

## Secondary diagnosis
Influenza due to other identified influenza virus with unspecified type of pneumonia
Unspecified bacterial pneumonia
Advanced COPD
Benign prostate hyperplasia

## Main diagnosis 
J10.0 Influenza due to other identified influenza virus with unspecified type of pneumonia

## Differential diagnosis
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease with (acute) exacerbation
